audio_caption: The clip starts with a brief conversation between a male and a female, debating which one is the better athlete. This discussion appears related to NFL and gymnastics, as the female speaker mentions the debate involves Simone Biles and her husband. She recounts how her husband struggled with her gym workout, while she excelled at an NFL workout, seemingly implying her athletic superiority. The conversation then transitions to upbeat, energetic music with a pop or electronic style, maintaining a consistent and driving rhythm. The instruments seem to include synthesizers and percussion, creating a high-spirited mood. No specific background sounds are present beyond the music.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker enthusiastically describing how "Simone Biles and Jonathan Owens get along famously." He elaborates on their unique love story, mentioning their initial encounter at a Texans game in 2019 and their subsequent meeting on the dating app Raya in March 2020, emphasizing that "it was Biles who made the first move." Simone is quoted saying, "I saw him and I was like, 'Oh, he's pretty cute, so I said hi.'" She describes how they started chatting due to living in the Houston area and hung out soon after.

The audio clip begins with light, upbeat music. A man speaks, explaining how two people spent time together during the pandemic, a perk athletes typically lack. He describes them alternating visits and their dogs playing together, and quotes, "we kind of had that time to ourselves to see if we like each other," and then "we kind of were just like magnets." Another man echoes the sentiment, saying they wanted to see each other more. The man also notes, "my dog really loved her." The music then resumes.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing a couple's decision to spend more time together early in their relationship. He mentions their engagement in 2022, almost two years after meeting on a dating app, noting that "people weren't surprised, but they were extremely supportive of the happy couple." This narration transitions into a brief segment of what seems to be music.

The clip begins with music, a pleasant tune which creates a warm mood. The music fades into the background as a male voice begins speaking in a neutral tone. He describes an Instagram post in which Simone said that saying yes was the "easiest yes" she'd ever had to say and looked forward to spending forever with her partner. The speaker continues, describing Jonathan's post in which he bragged about waking up with a fiance the day after Valentine's Day. He also thanked a friend for helping him plan the proposal, which his then-girlfriend had no clue about.

The clip begins with a male narrator describing Simone Biles obtaining a marriage license in April of 2023, quoting her Instagram post as saying, "almost time to say I do". He then states that "the couple had their courthouse wedding" and quotes the gymnast's Instagram story again, "we had to get married legally here in the US, since our wedding will be a destination wedding." The narrator mentions that she changed her Instagram and Twitter accounts to include her new last name. He continues by saying that she revealed that she and her husband weren't done celebrating their marriage because they had a destination wedding planned for May.

A male voice announces a wedding that took place in Cabo, Mexico in front of "144 guests," emphasizing the couple's light-hearted approach. The speaker quotes Simone sharing, "Jonathan and I just tuned into each other and blocked everyone out," and mentions her falling in love with him "all over." After being declared husband and wife, they walked to the "beat of water drums," and, according to Simone, whales were jumping out of the water. She adds that a sprinkle of rain and a full moon made the day "truly the most magical."

The audio begins with background music, sounding like a modern pop song with a mellow and slightly dreamy mood. The music fades to a quieter level as a male speaker begins to describe how "special the event was for her," saying she had it "pinned on her Instagram feed" with a caption about Mr. and Mrs. Owen. He proceeds to mention a Vanity Fair cover where she said "her wedding was better than her first Olympic win," noting she said, "I've never had so much fun in my life." He further quotes her as saying, "My wedding topped it" and "It was the greatest feeling ever." The man sounds conversational and informative. The audio concludes by mentioning she was taking time off from the sport at the time. The music remains quiet throughout.

The clip begins with male narration discussing Simone Biles' decision to step away from professional competition, citing mental health concerns. The narrator references "the twisties," a mental block, and her advocacy for mental health prioritization. A female speaker follows, sharing the sentiment, "For them, it's not an injury, but it almost is, and it has a worse effect on you." The male narration then returns, mentioning a two-year hiatus.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker excitedly summarizing a gymnast's impressive year, mentioning her comeback after her wedding, participation in competitions, and winning multiple medals, including gold at the Gymnastics World Championships, not to mention a move named after her. Throughout this speech, upbeat background music plays, lending an energetic tone to the narration.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing the negative feedback a man received for not knowing about his wife until months into their relationship. The speaker mentions that the wife is a gymnast. The tone is informative, almost like a news report. He says the man didn't realize the "magnitude of his wife's influence," and how she "never been bothered by the anecdote." The speaker goes on to state that the couple spent a lot of time together during the pandemic and that their love was "based on respect and genuine attraction over her stardom." Once the husband caught on, "he made up for it." There is music playing faintly in the background during this entire clip.

The audio clip begins with an upbeat and energetic pop song playing in the background. A male speaker starts talking in a conversational tone, mentioning that "Biles competed again in June 2021," he was there to watch his then-girlfriend compete. In a post he said "What an amazing experience," and expressing pride for her accomplishments. He concludes by saying the love and support remains as strong as ever and that "the NFL star recently signed with the Chicago Bears." The pop music continues playing underneath his speech.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing Simone Biles's live tweeting and move to Chicago, specifically mentioning the food and O'Hare International Airport. The speaker quotes her tweet, saying "So incredibly proud of my husband. The grind never stops." The speaker then notes that she celebrated her 27th birthday. The male speaker mentions Instagram stories featuring her birthday weekend with her husband. Continuing, the speaker says that her husband penned a sweet birthday message and quoted "Happy birthday to the most beautiful soul, my amazing wife." The speaker concludes with a question, "Will we actually see him supporting Simone Biles in Paris?"
